alert.note: Alert for Siskiyou (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 02 at 7:32PM PDT until August 02 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: The National Weather Service in Medford has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... North Central Siskiyou County in northern California... * Until 900 PM PDT. * At 732 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the McKinney Fire Fire area. The heaviest rain will be across the eastern half of the fire area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding and mudflows/debris flows caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding, mudflows or debris flows in the burn area. * Areas generally south and east of Klamath River in the McKinney Fire burn area. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Beware of debris and mud flows coming down off higher slopes and in drainages.
